reviews.review_msg: She was a very nice and accommodating prof! The exam was open book and critical thinking but everything is from the slides. Slides are really text heavy and she mostly just reads off the slides during class but she sometimes adds more details so it's still okay to attend. The algae paper guidelines were unclear so hope she fixes that in the future.
Very kind and knowledgeable. Slides are filled out and easy to follow with important information. Testing very fair but her 1 hour presentations are kind of annoying. Highly recommend, though.

Sherryl is super nice and genuinely loves teaching, especially about algae. Her lectures are straight forward and to the point, with all the info you need to succeed in her slides. Her exams are take home and are focused on applying your knowledge from the course to different situations. Lab portion (not Sherryl) felt miss-matched to the lecture

Despite the difficulties of teaching BISC 326 online, Sherryl did an amazing job. Labs consisted of assignments that required you to look info up online to answer questions. It was really straightforward and easy to do well in. Final was take-home and we had 4 days to write it. Definitely try this course with Sherryl!
Sherryl was fantastic! It is clear she cares very much for both the course topic and her students. Algae exam was more than fair!

Sherryl is an absolutely lovely professor that does an amazing job of facilitating a great learning environment. However, her lectures are disorganized and her exam questions are all theory and critical thinking, so be prepared to think about the big ideas and not memorization. Ask her questions!! She will answer them. :)
Super super nice. Lectures are disorganized but heavy emphasis on critical thinking and problem-solving is good. Overall good prof

Sherryl is probably one of the friendliest professors I have ever had SFU. She really wants to help you understand the subject and always is available for help. Extremely approachable, and very helpful. Her tests are fair and overall, just a really good prof. If you can take a class with her, then do it!
Really friendly and approachable prof. Would automatically come up and ask you if you have any questions. Lecture material was really boring but she tries her best to teach them enthusiastically.

Sherryl taught the algae portion of BISC 326 and I have to say that she was a great professor. Her interest in the material is high, as is her knowledge on the concepts. She was very approachable and very helpful when students needed any clarification. Overall, she has been one of my favorite's at SFU. Would DEFINITELY take another course with her!
Sherryl had a great attitude toward her students and was extremely approachable. She makes sure you understand the concepts and tested fairly.
Sheryl's great - a lot of fun, very friendly and has a lot of enthusiasm. Lectures were good, midterm was very reasonable. Recommend the proff and the course.

Really nice prof, I did learn lots! Labs were informative but def take a lot of pictures of all the stations since they're not available later on. Some activities were confusing since we didn't have enough background info and there were a lot of little assignments. Algae lab exam was hard so hope she fixes it. Last days of lab were sorta pointless.

I loved the activities Miranda prepared for the BISC326 lab. She is very sweet and approachable, and always had answers to my questions. The algae lab was incredibly hard however, and I wish I was more prepared for what the lab exams would look like.

Lab materials are spread between online info sheets, worksheets, and resources only accessible during lab time, which makes test preparation unnecessarily difficult and stressful. Lab activities are also unengaging and mostly pointless, and did not help with exam preparation.

Very kind, friendly and knowledgeable professor. Her lectures are great and her slides are very helpful. Testing and assignments are fair if you put in the time. She goes all the way to help her students and it shows. Would highly recommend.
Labs were LONG and almost kind of pointless. Lab midterm and final were NOT like what we learned during lab time!!! Spends too much time doing pointless activities.
